issue.title: where is roscore running in cloudsim?

content.raw:
> In general, how are we supposed to start ROS nodes? And if one dies, then restart it, without shell access? Alternatively, how do we get shell access to the container with just a VPN connection, without using the ssh key?

I believe these are the sorts of solutions which teams should come up with. Coming up with the communication between the OCU and the Field Computer is part of the challenge. The rules state: "*Teams may use any communications protocol they desire for communications between the OCU and the Field Computer, including UDP and TCP. The SRC will not impose or require exclusive use of particular protocols*."
content.html:
In general, how are we supposed to start ROS nodes? And if one dies, then restart it, without shell access? Alternatively, how do we get shell access to the container with just a VPN connection, without using the ssh key?

I believe these are the sorts of solutions which teams should come up with. Coming up with the communication between the OCU and the Field Computer is part of the challenge. The rules state: "Teams may use any communications protocol they desire for communications between the OCU and the Field Computer, including UDP and TCP. The SRC will not impose or require exclusive use of particular protocols."
